result.execSummary:
The defendant Deon Lamant Lowery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release Date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
Amendment to judgment

IT IS ORDERED that, on the court's own motion, the time to file transcripts is extended to July 30, 2019.    IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended to November 12, 2019.
Response by State Public Defender to Court of  Appeals order

IT IS ORDERED that, on the court's own motion, the time to file a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief is extended to June 6, 2018.    IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within twenty-one days of the date of this order the Office of the State Public Defender shall move for an extension of the time to appoint counsel, or otherwise respond to this order.    IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion to extend the time to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is held in abeyance.
Motion to Court of Appeals to Extend Time for Filing of Postconviction Motion
April 5, 2016
April 13, 2016
Henry
